intro: Trinia glaberrima var. stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruited trinia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a mild, spicy scent. This variety is noted for its compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
